meanings.definition: Instruct or improve (someone) morally or intellectually.
meanings.sent1: Reading books can edify your mind and help you learn new things.
meanings.sent2: Teachers play a crucial role in edifying students through education and guidance.
meanings.sent3: The wise elder always had a story to edify the young ones during campfires.
meanings.sent4: Just like how sunlight edifies plants, knowledge nourishes the mind.
meanings.sent5: The documentary was designed to edify viewers on the importance of recycling.

meanings.sent1: Visiting the serene temple can edify your soul and bring peace.
meanings.sent2: The spiritual leader's words never failed to edify the hearts of his followers.
meanings.sent3: The beautiful hymns sung by the choir seemed to edify the very air around them.
meanings.sent4: As the sun rises, it seems to edify the world with its warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scriptures were said to edify those who sought spiritual enlightenment.

meanings.definition: To build up or strengthen (someone) in faith or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The mentor's guidance helped edify the young apprentice's skills and confidence.
meanings.sent2: Attending workshops can edify your understanding of complex topics.
meanings.sent3: The constant encouragement from friends can edify your spirit during tough times.
meanings.sent4: Just like how exercise edifies muscles, studying edifies the mind.
meanings.sent5: The supportive community was there to edify each member's faith and beliefs.
